results.title: Tenants
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “A Place of Your Own”.
The rental market is seen as the traditional first step for young people leaving home. This tape looks at the situation for three young people

results.title: Ten years of Countdown
results.brief_description: The first ten years of Countdown coincided with, and was part of, an incredible growth in the Australian music scene. The emergence of a wealth of new talent, highlighted by Countdown appearances, is represented by the performances which includes Skyhooks, AC/DC, Australian Crawl, Split Enz, Inxs, Mondo Rock, Renee Geyer, Richard Clapton, Ted Mulray Gang and others.

results.title: Ten years of co-op credit
results.creator_credit: United States. Dept. of Agriculture and Walter Scott
results.brief_description: This film tells the story of rural production credit associations in the US during World War 2. These associations were set up by farmers to help each other and themselves through the depression years; in 1943 they were helping to boost agricultural production as part of the national war effort of the US during WW2.

results.title: Ten years after...ten years older
results.creator_credit: Anna Kannava and Australian Film Commission
results.brief_description: After a ten year absence, the filmmaker returns to her beloved country of birth - Cyprus. This film is about a return to origins, memory, expectations and realisations. 1987 ATOM Award finalist.

results.title: Ten step discipline program
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Help for parents”
Ten step discipline program: Steps 1 to 3 helps teachers use Reality Therapy on themselves. Steps 4 to 6 provide teachers with a simple but effective approach. Steps 7 to 10 consider what procedures can be followed if students refuse to change their behaviour.

results.title: Ten days that shook the world
results.creator_credit: Norman Swallow, Grigori Alexandrov, Granada International Productions and Filmske Novosti
results.brief_description: A dramatic reconstruction of many of the historic events of the 1917 Russian Revolution on the locations where they actually happened. Men and women personally involved in the Revolution talk about what happened to them in those dramatic ten days. The producers had access to official Soviet files, film archives and libraries. Some of the newsreel material has not been seen before. Narration is by Orson Welles, supported by the voices of Robert Stephens, Barbara Jefford, Janet Suzman and Hugh Burden.

results.title: Ten commandments of love
results.brief_description: A photographic still image of two people in an impassioned embrace on an ocean pier. Harvey and the Moonglows start singing ‘The ten commandments of love’ to a background of changing color.

results.title: Ten bob in winter
results.creator_credit: British Film Institute Experimental Film Fund and Lloyd Reckford
results.brief_description: Unemployed, a young coloured man living in London borrows ten shillings to see him through until he gets a job. He has no luck at the Employment Exchange, and to add to his troubles, he is `touched’ by an out-of-work fellow countryman who needs ten shillings to redeem his guitar from the pawnbroker so that he can play at a dance. While the musician is in the shop, the young man meets a rather snobbish well-off friend from whom he tries to conceal his position - a humorous position well exploited. Sharp evocation of its time - duffel coats and modern jazz score by the Joe Harriot Quintet.

results.title: Tempo: Australia in the 70's [Italan version]
results.creator_credit: Roland Beckett, Australian Commonwealth Film Unit and Keith Gow
results.brief_description: Gives impressions of life and industry in Australia at the beginnings of the 1970’s with the emphasis on the potential for growth and development. Peter Weir co-wrote the script with Keith Gow and Martin Von Borneman was the Director of Photography. Animation by Yoram Gross. The original production has been dubbed in Italian.
